name: Trivial Stuff 2 Trivia Game | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the classic comedy skit performed by Abbot and Costello, "Who's on first?",  name the right fielder.
questions.correct: No one since it wasn't mentioned in the skit
questions.explanation:
No one since it wasn't mentioned in the skit.

	Whos on first -Whats on second-I don't know is on third-I don't care is the shortstop-Today is the catcher-Tomorrow is the pitcher-Why is the left fielder-Because is the center fielder

questions.text: How many road movies did Bob Hope and Bing Crosby star in together?
questions.explanation:
Seven.

	They started with "The Road to Singapore" in 1940 and finished with "The Road to Hong Kong" in 1962.

questions.text: "Steamboat Willie" was the first cartoon shown in US theaters.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The 1909 cartoon "Gertie the Dinosaur" became the first cartoon to be shown in movie houses along with a regular feature movie.

questions.text: What is the most popular name for popes?
questions.explanation:
John.

	There have been 23 Johns (and 2 John Pauls), 16 Gregorys, 15 Benedicts and 14 Clements.

questions.text: In Greek mythology who is Nike?
questions.explanation:
The goddess of victory.

	Nike was the daughter of the giant Pallas and the river Styx.  In Roman mythology she is known as Victoria.

questions.text: What jockey has won the Triple Crown twice?
questions.explanation:
Eddie Arcaro.

	Eddie Arcaro won it in 1941 aboard Whirlaway and then again in 1948 with Citation.

questions.text: How many brothers are there In Dostoyevsky's 1880 novel The Brothers Karamazov?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Dmitri, Ivan, Alyosha and Smerdyakov.  Dmitri is the son accused of kiling his father.

questions.text: Are there any bones in the body that don't connect with other bones?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	The hyoid bone resides by itself in the throat.  It supports the tongue and its muscles.

questions.text: In what state was the first drive-in movie?
questions.explanation:
New Jersey.

	A 10 acre site in Camden, NJ was opened on June 6, 1933.  The screen measured 40 by 30 feet and there was room for 400 cars.

questions.text: In what year was the first chewing gum introduced?
questions.explanation:
1871.

	The flavorless Adams New York Chewing Gum was developed by Thomas Adams.  Flavored gum follwed in 1875 and bubble gum was introduced in 1885.
